name: Oxazepam (Serax)
summary: Oxazepam is a short- to intermediate-acting benzodiazepine used for the treatment of anxiety disorders, alcohol withdrawal symptoms, and for short-term relief of insomnia.
description: Oxazepam is a benzodiazepine with anxiolytic, sedative, hypnotic, and muscle relaxant properties. It works by enhancing the effect of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) at the GABA-A receptor, producing calming effects on the central nervous system. It has a relatively slow onset and is often preferred in elderly patients and those with liver impairment due to its direct glucuronidation metabolism.

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to oxazepam or other benzodiazepines
monitoring_required: Signs of sedation and respiratory depression
Symptoms of dependence and withdrawal on discontinuation

items: Short-term management of insomnia associated with anxiety

sections.text: Oxazepam enhances the effect of GABA, an inhibitory neurotransmitter, by binding to the benzodiazepine site on the GABA-A receptor, increasing the frequency of chloride channel opening, and resulting in CNS depression.

geriatric.Initial dose: 10 mg orally 3 times daily or at bedtime; increase cautiously

sections.hepatic_impairment: Generally safe; preferred benzodiazepine in liver impairment due to metabolism via direct conjugation

sections.text: Onset within 1-2 hours; duration of effect approximately 6-12 hours.

sections.black_box: Benzodiazepines can cause severe sedation, respiratory depression, coma, and death when combined with opioids.
other: Risk of abuse, misuse, and addiction
May cause dependence and withdrawal symptoms upon discontinuation
Use with caution in patients with a history of substance use disorder

items: Monitor for sedation and respiratory depression
Assess for signs of misuse or dependence
Gradual taper recommended to avoid withdrawal

sections.pregnancy: Category D: Avoid unless benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid or monitor infant closely
sections.geriatrics: Preferred benzodiazepine due to favorable metabolism profile; start at lower doses

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction recommended to minimize withdrawal symptoms; typical taper 10-25% reduction every 1-2 weeks.

items: Preferred in patients with liver impairment as it bypasses oxidative metabolism
Less prone to accumulation than some longer-acting benzodiazepines
Avoid abrupt discontinuation after prolonged use

seo.description: Oxazepam (Serax) is a short-acting benzodiazepine used to manage anxiety, alcohol withdrawal symptoms, and insomnia due to anxiety.
